intro: Licaria hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy licaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in tropical and subtropical regions.
